intro: Romulea albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin gladiolus, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble those of the gladiolus. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with distinctive white margins. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Romulea albomarginata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable climates.
